My Ministers will work for good relations with the Soviet Union and thecountries of Eastern Europe; for peace in the Middle East; and for improvedrelations with the People's Republic of China. Estimates for the public services will be laid before you.MY LORDS AND MEMBERS OP THE HOUSE OP commons. At home My government's first care will be to strengthen the economy and promote sound growth of output and employment. Their aim will be tocurb inflation, encourage increased efficiency, and maintain a strongbalance of payments. They will pay special attention to the needs of areas suffering from insufficient economic development.9. Legislation will be brought before you to promote vigorous competition and fair trading and to extend customers' protection in the sale of goods and services. Other measures will provide for extending the ShipbuildingCredit Scheme, for reorganising the structure of the gas industry, for assisting the exploration of our mineral resources, and for encouragingBritish investment overseas through the establishment of an insurancescheme.10. My Ministers will pursue their proposals for reforming the tax system and will bring forward legislation to establish a value-added tax and to reform company taxation.11. My Ministers will continue to encourage the expansion of an efficientagriculture and iiri.ll introduce legislation to simplify and improveadministration. They will support the United Nations in preparing for aConference on the Law of the Sea in 1973-12. A draft Code of Industrial Relations Practice will be presented for your approval and proposals will be made for developing training facilities to meet future manpower needs.2 13* Bills will be brought before you to reform the finance of rentedhousing and to provide more help for public and private tenants in need.14- Powers will be sought to facilitate the reform of pensions schemes inthe public services.15* Provision for higher and further education will continue to heexpanded and the replacement and improvement of primary school buildingswill be speeded up. The school leaving age will be raised to 16. [grants to direct grant schools will be increased. J*16. Legislation will be introduced to give effect to the governments proposals for the reorganisation of local government in England (outsideGreater London) and in Wales.17* A Bill id.ll be laid before you to reorganise the health services inScotland.18. My Government will pursue with vigour their policies for improving the environment. Legislation will be proposed to extend the powers oflocal authorities to protect buildings in conservation areas and toincrease protection for ancient monuments.19o Legislation will be introduced to provide for an alternative serviceof local radio broadcasting.20. A Bill will be introduced to enable certain museums to charge for admission.21. My Government acknowledge and share public concern at the growth of violent crime. They will lay before you provisions to strengthen theadministration of criminal justice. In particular, provision will bemade to enlarge the powers of the courts to award alternative penaltiesto custodial sentences and to require offenders to make reparation totheir victims.^Subject to the outcome of the Public Expenditure Review3 22.
